title: How to Make Brazo De Gitano

steps.headline: Line a 8” x 15 tin pan with waxed paper.
steps.description: Grease the lining with baking spray.

steps.headline: Separate the egg yolks, add sugar, vanilla and baking powder, until the mix is smooth and thick.
Beat the egg whites in a separate bowl until fluffy.
steps.description: Fold the whites into the yolk mixture using a spatula.

steps.headline: Pour batter into tin and spread out evenly.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
steps.description: The cake should be firm but not dry.

steps.headline: Let cool for 5 minutes, then cover with a towel.
steps.description: Carefully flip over onto the towel, Remove the paper, and then roll the cake in the towel. Let cool for another 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Unroll the cake, carefully spread the custard, buttercream or spread of your choice.

text: Preheat oven to 325°F (162°C).  Line a 8” x 15 tin pan with waxed paper. Grease the lining with baking spray. Separate the egg yolks, add sugar, vanilla and baking powder, until the mix is smooth and thick.  Beat the egg whites in a separate bowl until fluffy. Fold the whites into the yolk mixture using a spatula. Pour batter into tin and spread out evenly.  Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. The cake should be firm but not dry. Let cool for 5 minutes, then cover with a towel. Carefully flip over onto the towel, Remove the paper, and then roll the cake in the towel. Let cool for another 5 to 10 minutes. Unroll the cake, carefully spread the custard, buttercream or spread of your choice. Roll up the cake again. Sprinkle with confectioner's sugar.  Finished.
